subject: Adding store location proxy to domain

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 1: (11 inline comments)

Patch Set 1:

about StoreLocations specific tests, flaper87, do you think glance/tests/unit/test_store_image.py is ok for you? also I will add some integration/functional test case in the location PATCH interface patch (locations add/remove/replace), i think there will cover a lot of location proxy (StoreLocations) functional case also.

Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Hey,

Some comments in-line. As mentioned, I'd prefer defining locations in the class constructor instead. Do you think it is possible to get rid of the 'locations' attribute as well?

I mean, being able to do something like:

  self.locations = _locations(self.image.locations)

I know it becomes a bit tricky when you need to set the value but I guess you could simply update the local var.

Patch Set 7: (1 inline comment)

Hi flaper87, I consider keep the consistent 'proxy' style is a good choice to us, from the existing domain object code, example as following, the 'proxy' are all expose via attribute, so I think it's good for 'locations' proxy attribute also.
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/domain/proxy.py#L103
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/authorization.py#L249


Other hand, I have not saw the value to use locations var in the class constructor instead.


Or I miss some points, please correct me if wrong.

Patch Set 7:

The benefits I see are:

  * Local context (instead of defining it in the class, it just takes whatever the instance will pass to it)

  * Less magic: It will get an object instance to use instead of attributes' names that will be used for getting that object instance

  * Easier to extend in the future. 

I don't like the fact it receives attributes names and does a getattr on self, looks fragile to me. Also, it doesn't checks whether the attribute actually exists, which means that whenever the attribute "image" is removed from "self" it would just break. That's an unlikely situation but, you never know!

Hope the above makes sense!

Patch Set 7:

1. For 'Local context' and 'Less magic' parts I partly agree that, but this kind of 'proxy' design which based on attribute (not this patch only but all them in domain obje also) is for gain the balance IMO, it lose those two benefits but get maximum flexibility, as other domain objects shown, when we add some new proxy layer to domain, we can easily to add more attributes proxy base the same proxy function structure, we can easily get the class context vaiable by a attribute string, but not care the real context object reference. So I think there is not specific right or wrong in there.
2. It's not tricky and easy to understand in the first sight.
3. In your suggestion, it also need call 'getattar()' by a attribute name string.
4. According to currenct domain objects implementation, those are a lot of proxies based on an attribute, so if you persist in your opinion I think we can propose to take the refactoring in feature within a dedicated BP to cover the changing of moving attribute based proxy to class variable based proxy.

Patch Set 7:

Oops, seems copy&paste could breaking the response text format, sorry for that.

Patch Set 7:

Hey,

    * re 2: IMHO, figuring out where the attrs are being retrieved from is less clear than passing the obj instance.

    * re 3: I know. I wrote in my first comment that I'd prefer not passing any attribute name at all and I also suggested a way to do it.

    * re 4: I'm not suggesting to change the way the proxy works, I'm suggesting to change what the property closure receives and make it less magic and more clear, the rest will just be as it is.

Patch Set 7:

Hey, 

*Re 4, I understand, I have used the way what current domain objects using, so according to current domain objects implementation, if you persist in your opinion I think we can propose to take the refactoring in feature within a dedicated BP to cover the changing of the proxy interface.

Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Hi Folks,

Flavio, I agree the way the getattr(getattr(getattr(..), ..), ..) works is not at all clear. However, I don't think you can simply move a property declaration down to an instance attribute. See https://gist.github.com/markwash/5952512 for details.

Patch Set 7:

Just want to add a little more context. Zhi Yan is borrowing a usage I defined elsewhere in the domain model. I was not completely happy with it, because it had so many getattr calls, so I originally tried to fix it along the lines Flavio suggested. However, I bumped into the problem I noted in the gist in my pervious comment. I have concluded that there is unfortunately not a clear way to improve on this issue, without resorting to complex meta classes.

I'm not saying I don't want to resort to metaclasses. But I do not think we should block this h-2 blueprint for the getattr issue.
Uploaded patch set 8.
